Most of you are probably not aware of this, so I thought I'd just let you k=
now:

maven-surefire plugin has 2 different junit-4 providers, and the most=
 modern one is normally only used to run parallel tests. This provider uses=
 JUnitCore to run the tests and should (probably) support most of the "mode=
rn" junit features.

The "thing" is that the JunitCore provider can be acti=
vated even for non-parallel tests by adding the following to your configura=
tion:

<parallel>none</parallel>

This will force the use of the new provid=
er in serial mode, which is fine if you just want to get access to more mod=
ern junit features.

Please note that right now you need to use 2.6-SNAPSHO=
T of surefire to get the latest version of the JunitCore provider.  Which i=
s really the reason I'm writing this: I'm about to release a bug-fix releas=
e of surefire (which will probably be called 2.5.1). I do not personally ha=
ve time to test all the "new" junit features with the new provider, but if =
anyone here has time/interest in this I can get it included in the official=
 surefire documentation.
